url.description: URL on which to serve the content

durable.description: if true, the exchange will survive broker restarts.

internal.description: if true, messages cannot be published directly to the exchange (i.e., it can only be the target of bindings, or possibly create messages ex-nihilo).

autoDelete.description: if true, the exchange will be destroyed once the number of bindings for which it is the source drop to zero.

alternateExchange.description:
an exchange to send messages to if this exchange canâ€™t route them to any queues.

Specific to RabbitMQ

arguments.description: any additional arguments that may be needed by an exchange

url.description: URL on which to serve the content

type.description: Type of delayer registered in WaitDelayerFactoryRegistry

workerDelayer.description: Delayer between two failed attempts to process messages

workerParallelism.description: Define if worker should process multi message received in //

maxConsumers.description: Max number of queue consumers Queue will auto increase to this max number if queue is loaded and it will decrease to just one consumer if no messages are available
